de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Class ClientConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.ClientConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener, OnCommandListener, NetworkDataSink

    class ClientConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements OnCommandListener, NetworkDataSink, ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener
    This class manages the command- and data connection for a single client. It intercepts the following commands: ConnectionAliveCheck and ChangeSensorSensitivity and SensorRangeNotification and EndConnection, never notifying the command listener of receiving them or converting them to listener calls. When a EndConnection command is received, all ports are closed, and the command is forwarded; no other command can be sent to the client after that.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientConnection

        ClientConnection(java.lang.String serverName,
                 ExceptionListener exceptionListener,
                 OnCommandListener commandListener,
                 ClientListener clientListener,
                 NetworkDataSink dataSink,
                 UnexpectedClientListener unexpectedClientListener)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new client connection handler, which will immediately begin listening on random ports. They may be retrieved using getCommandPort() and getDataPort().
        Parameters:
        serverName - how the client connection should identify the server
        exceptionListener - Who to notify about unhandleable exceptions
        commandListener - Who to notify about commands
        dataSink - Where to put data
        clientListener - who to notify of client events
        unexpectedClientListener - Who to notify if commands arrive from a foreign client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the listening process could not be started

          throws java.io.IOException
        Send a command to this client
        Parameters:
        command - the command to be sent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error other than ConnectException occurred. If a ConnectException occurred, the client is likely listening no longer.

      • getClient

        @NotNull
NetworkDevice getClient()
        Retrieve the client this connection handler is bound to
        Returns:
        a fully configured NetworkDevice representing the client.

      • handleConnectionRequest

        void handleConnectionRequest(NetworkDevice client,
                             boolean acceptClient)
                      throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Handle a connection request to this client connection. If acceptClient is true, this instance may not be used to handle another client.
        Parameters:
        client - the client that wants to connect
        acceptClient - true if the client should be accepted, and this instance be bound to it
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the clients address could not be parsed to an InetAddress. Unlikely...
